sentences.en: ‘Do you see what I mean?’ ‘Sort of,’ answered Jean cautiously.
sentences.cn: “你明白我说的意思了吗？”“有点明白了，”琼小心翼翼地回答。

sentences.en: ‘I'll pay.’ ‘You'll do nothing of the sort.’.
sentences.cn: “我来付钱。”“那绝对不行。”。

sentences.en: “Gambling and prostitution . . . have been prohibited, but only sort of”(&b{George F. Will})
sentences.cn: “赌博与妓院…已经被查禁了，但只是有点儿不彻底”(&b{乔治F.威尔})

sentences.en: a constitutional government of a sort.
sentences.cn: 符合宪法的平庸的政府

sentences.en: Any sort of wrong-doing had to be rooted out.
sentences.cn: 必须杜绝任何不道德的事发生。

sentences.en: he was wearing make-up—well, it takes all sorts.
sentences.cn: 他居然化了妆——天啊，世上的人真是无奇不有。

sentences.en: He would sort out his own problems, in time.
sentences.cn: 他早晚会解决自己的问题。

sentences.en: I am in some sort indebted to you.
sentences.cn: 我在某种程度上要感谢你。

sentences.en: I have to sort some things out. We really needed to talk.
sentences.cn: 我必须把一些事情搞清楚。我们真的需要谈一谈。

sentences.en: I really feel aggrieved at this sort of thing.
sentences.cn: 我真为这种事感到委屈。

sentences.en: I'm a cheery sort of person, so I like cheerful tones.
sentences.cn: 我是个活泼类型的人，因此喜欢明亮的色调。

sentences.en: I'm sure it was just some sort of mix-up.
sentences.cn: 我相信这只不过是一次失误。

sentences.en: if he can't pay you, I'll sort him out.
sentences.cn: 要是他付不出钱给你，我会教训他的。

sentences.en: Just how much kneading is required depends on the sort of flour.
sentences.cn: 需要揉多久取决于用哪种面。

sentences.en: knew many folktales of sorts.
sentences.cn: 知道许多各种各样的民间故事

sentences.en: List the key headings and sort them into a logical order.
sentences.cn: 列出关键标题并按逻辑顺序排列。

sentences.en: managed to paint the chair after a sort.
sentences.cn: 随意地把椅子画下来

sentences.en: Minorca is the sort of place that caters for families.
sentences.cn: 梅诺卡岛是那种适合家庭旅游的地方。

sentences.en: Most of the victims developed psychological problems of one sort or another (= of various different types ) .
sentences.cn: 大多数受害者都出现了这样那样的心理问题。

sentences.en: Most of the victims developed psychological problems of one sort or another (= of various different types ).
sentences.cn: 大多数受害者都出现了这样那样的心理问题。

sentences.en: she started &B{sorting out} the lettuce &B{from} the spinach.
sentences.cn: 她开始把生菜从菠菜中拣出来。

sentences.en: she'd never imagined Steve to be the marrying sort.
sentences.cn: 她从来都没有想过史蒂夫会是想结婚的那一种人。

sentences.en: That sort of romantic attitude cuts no ice with money-men.
sentences.cn: 那种不切实际的态度对金融家们根本不起什么作用。

sentences.en: That's just the sort of abuse that he will be investigating.
sentences.cn: 他要调查的正是这一类虐待行为。

sentences.en: The eggs are sorted according to size.
sentences.cn: 这些鸡蛋是按大小分类的。

sentences.en: The teacher is out of sorts this morning.
sentences.cn: 今天上午老师心情不好

sentences.en: the training camp actually became a tourist attraction of sorts.
sentences.cn: 这个训练营实际上近乎成了旅游观光的地方。

sentences.en: There's a nasty sort of rumour going around about it.
sentences.cn: 关于这件事正有一则恶意的谣言在流传。

sentences.en: they are anxious to sort out travelling arrangements.
sentences.cn: 他们急着要做旅行安排。

sentences.en: They do burgers, pizzas, that sort of thing .
sentences.cn: 他们供应汉堡包、比萨饼什么的。

sentences.en: They do burgers, pizzas, that sort of thing.
sentences.cn: 他们供应汉堡包、比萨饼什么的。

sentences.en: This sort of thing really is quite beyond the pale.
sentences.cn: 这种事情真是不可接受。

sentences.en: Why don't you come home with me until you sort things out?
sentences.cn: .。。你何不先和我一起回家，等事情解决了再走？

sentences.en: You can't put that sort of fear into words.
sentences.cn: 那种恐惧无法用语言表达。

phrases.tran_cn: 有点儿：以一种随意或者不完美的方式

phrases.phrase: it takes all sorts to make a world
phrases.tran_cn: (谚)世上的人无奇不有（常用来表示说话人对某种奇怪行为的评价）
［用来断然否定或反驳先前的话语或设想］ 绝对不行，没那回事儿
(非正式)勉强称得上的，有点不寻常的

phrases.phrase: of sorts 或 of a sort
phrases.tran_cn: 各种各样的，非此即彼的
选择排序法；选择分类排序
(非正式)有点儿（表达不确切或模糊）

phrases.phrase: sort out the men from the boys

trans.tran_en: a group or class of people, things etc that have similar qualities or features
to put things in a particular order or arrange them in groups according to size, type etc
to put things in a particular order or arrange them in groups according to size, type etc
to put things in a particular order or arrange them in groups according to size, type etc
